intro: Adetogramma, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are shrubs or small trees, typically characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Adetogramma species often have capsules as their fruit type, containing numerous small seeds. They are valued in traditional medicine and horticulture for their ornamental qualities and medicinal properties.
